page.title: 18BASS CHARRINGTON'S BREWERY
page.content: To make beer you need yeast, hops, water, sugar & barley. The yeast has to be mixed carefully or it wil die. We rubbed some hops on our hands to see if we could feel the sticky oils. They boil the water and add the raw materials. It is then put into fermenting tanks for about 5-7 days. When it is ready they put it into cans, bottles & metal kegs. The first thing that hit us was the smell of yeast. The floor was very clean and smelled of bleach. Inside the bottling plant it was very noisy as all of the machines were buzzing and the bottles & cans were rattling. The bottles came from a big washing machine on a conveyor belt and are filled 20 at a time. We were given a can of Barbican. I found the trip very interesting but it put me off beer.
